briefdescription.para: Callback used when data needs to be sent to the server.

parameterdescription.para: User specified data specified in http_client_req()

simplesect.para: >=0 amount of data sent, in this case http_client_req() should continue sending data, <0 if http_client_req() should return the error code to the caller.

briefdescription.para: Callback can be used if application wants to construct additional HTTP headers when the HTTP request is sent. Usage of this is optional.

parameterdescription.para: User specified data specified in http_client_req()

simplesect.para: >=0 amount of data sent, in this case http_client_req() should continue sending data, <0 if http_client_req() should return the error code to the caller.

briefdescription.para: Callback used when data is received from the server.

parameterdescription.para: Does this data buffer contain all the data or is there still more data to come.
User specified data specified in http_client_req()

memberdef.argsstring: (int sock, struct http_request *req, int32_t timeout, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: http_client_req

briefdescription.para: Do a HTTP request. The callback is called when data is received from the HTTP server. The caller must have created a connection to the server before calling this function so connect() call must have be done successfully for the socket.

parameterdescription.para: Max timeout to wait for the data. The timeout value cannot be 0 as there would be no time to receive the data. The timeout value is in milliseconds.
User specified data that is passed to the callback.

simplesect.para: <0 if error, >=0 amount of data sent to the server

detaileddescription.para: An API for applications do HTTP requests
